sen.j: 上下巻にわかれており、上巻は、堀河天皇の看護を、下巻は鳥羽天皇についてを描く。
sen.e: This book consisted of 2 volumes with Volume 1 depicting Nagako's days while attending to Emperor Horikawa prior to his death and with Volume 2 describing Emperor Toba.
The book consists of two volumes, with volume one depicting Nagako's days as a nurse for Emperor Horikawa prior to his death, and volume two describing Emperor Toba.
sen.cmt: I'm on the fence as to whether or not "Volume One" and "Volume Two" should stay capitalized, but it seems more natural to have them lowercase; 看護を→"as a nurse"; fixed grammar
sen.e: The book consists of two volumes, with volume one depicting Nagako's days as a nurse for Emperor Horikawa prior to his death, and volume two describing Emperor Toba.

sen.j: 特に下巻は、文中、現在と過去がめまぐるしく入れ替わり、堀河天皇を追慕する心情を描いている。
sen.e: In Volume 2, Nagako described her feelings revering the memory of Emperor Horikawa with her writing frequently going back and forth between the present and old days.
In volume two, Nagako alternates between the past and the present describing sentiments of cherishing the memory of Emperor Horikawa.
sen.cmt: "going back and forth" is all right, but a little wordy, so I changed it to "alternating"; "old days"→"past"; "feelings"→"sentiments"; "revering"→ "cherishing"; rearranged sentence structure to read more naturally
sen.e: In volume two, Nagako alternates between the past and the present describing sentiments of cherishing the memory of Emperor Horikawa.
